cyclone.name: NESTOR
cyclone.current_location: about 355 miles southwest of Panama City, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: tracking northeast toward the Florida Panhandle, then expected to sweep east-northeast across the southeastern United States and move offshore North Carolina late Sunday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Panhandle near the Panama City–Apalachicola area

weather_observation.warning_coast: Storm Surge Warning from Indian Pass FL to Clearwater Beach FL; Tropical Storm Warning from the Mississippi/Alabama border to Yankeetown FL and from Grand Isle LA to the Mouth of the Pearl River
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from Louisiana through the Florida Panhandle with surge extending southward along the west-central Florida coast including Tampa Bay
weather_observation.wind: Gusty on-shore winds 25–35 mph with occasional higher gusts possible in squalls; sustained tropical-storm-force winds are unlikely at the port
weather_observation.storm_surge: Water levels in Tampa Bay could rise 1–3 ft above normally dry ground if peak surge coincides with high tide
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain totaling 2–4 inches, locally higher, during Friday night through Saturday
weather_observation.other_hazards: Low but non-zero tornado risk in outer rain bands across the Florida peninsula
